alert.note: Alert for McCreary (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 5:49PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern McCreary County. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 546 PM EDT, Weather radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen as of 5:45 PM. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Parkers Lake, Greenwood, Honeybee and Cumberland Falls S.P. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are many low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
